Administration's Strong Criticism

A White House spokesperson denounced the museum's 'Entertainment Nation' exhibit for framing American cultural icons through what they called a politically charged lens. Criticized displays include interpretations of Mickey Mouse's origins and circus history being tied to colonialism.

Smithsonian circus plaque describing colonial themes

Exhibit Content Under Scrutiny

The 1928 Mickey Mouse cartoon Steamboat Willie is described as containing "vestiges of blackface minstrelsy," while a Magnum P.I. display addresses perceptions of Vietnam veterans. Sections on Jon Stewart's Daily Show and late singer Selena Quintanilla-Pérez emphasize media skepticism and identity politics.

Smithsonian exhibit on modern gender roles with Mae West and Judy Garland

Institutional Pushback and Reforms

Administration officials confirmed a comprehensive audit of Smithsonian content to align it with "American founding principles." The Institution stated it remains committed to "unbiased presentation of facts" while reviewing exhibits. Approximately 66% of the museum's $1 billion budget comes from federal funding.

Political Dimensions of Cultural Representation

President Trump's March executive order targeted alleged revisionist history in museums, accusing cultural institutions of undermining national achievements. The Board of Regents – including the Vice President and Supreme Court Chief Justice – oversees the Smithsonian's operations amidst this ideological clash.

The permanent exhibit, launched in December 2022, claims to explore entertainment's role in shaping American identity but faces accusations of promoting activist agendas. A White House representative emphasized: "Americans deserve a Smithsonian that inspires national pride, not social change subversion."

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Ferrihydrite Mineral Hints at Mars' Habitable Past
fields.summary: New research suggests Mars' distinctive red coloration originates from ferrihydrite, a mineral that forms in water-rich environments, indicating the planet may have had cooler, wetter conditions billions of years ago that could have supported life.
fields.content:
Mars' signature red hue may stem from ferrihydrite rather than hematite, according to a NASA-funded study. Unlike hematite which dominates current theories, ferrihydrite forms at lower temperatures in water-rich settings. This mineral evidence points to Mars having sustained liquid water during its early history.

"This suggests that Mars may have had an environment capable of sustaining liquid water before it transitioned from a wet to a dry environment billions of years ago," NASA stated in their announcement of the findings.

Lead researcher Adam Valantinas, from Brown University and University of Bern, explained: "The fundamental question of why Mars is red has been considered for hundreds if not for thousands of years." He added: "From our analysis, ferrihydrite appears ubiquitous in Martian dust and rock. Our novel laboratory methods allowed us to simulate Martian conditions for the first time to test this theory."

The surface of Mars

Senior author Jack Mustard called the research a "door-opening opportunity" for understanding planetary evolution: "It helps us reconstruct mineral formation conditions. The Perseverance rover's sample return mission will be crucial to verify these findings." Brown University researchers confirmed the study indicates Mars likely had a cool, wet climate conducive to life in ancient times.

lab sample of simulated Mars dust

Co-author Geronimo Villanueva from NASA Goddard Space Flight Center stated: "These findings point to potentially habitable ancient conditions on Mars, highlighting the value of international collaborations in solar system exploration." Valantinas emphasized ongoing questions: "To understand potential ancient life, we must grasp ferrihydrite's formation context - requiring oxygen and water interactions now absent."

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Why Experts Warn Against Sleeping With Wet Hair
fields.summary: Hairstylists and dermatologists warn that sleeping with wet hair can cause significant damage to hair and scalp health. Moisture combined with pillow friction leads to split ends, fungal growth, and skin irritation, with experts providing practical solutions to prevent these issues.
fields.content:
Sleeping with wet hair may cause multiple health and beauty concerns according to hair and skin professionals. Briana Delvecchio, a New York-based hairstylist at Ashley Lauren Beauty Lounge, emphasizes that going to bed with damp hair creates several problems beyond simple inconvenience.

"Combining moisture with pillowcase friction results in split ends, tangles, and long-term damage," Delvecchio explained. She further noted this practice can trigger scalp irritation, dandruff, and surprisingly oily roots by morning.

woman with hair in a towel on bed

Scalp and Skin Complications

This moisture transfers to pillowcases, creating bacterial breeding grounds that may cause facial breakouts. Board-certified dermatologist Dr. Noah Gratch agrees, warning that fragile wet hair becomes more damage-prone from friction.

A damp scalp creates ideal conditions for yeast overgrowth such as Malassezia, leading to conditions like seborrheic dermatitis or dandruff," Dr. Gratch stated. He added the moist environment increases risks of folliculitis and fungal infections especially for sensitive or oily scalps.

Woman sleeping in bed at night

Preventive Measures

To mitigate these issues, Delvecchio recommends thorough towel-drying plus leave-in conditioner application before bed. She suggests either blow-drying on low heat or braiding nearly-dry hair loosely as alternatives.

"Adjusting your nighttime routine significantly improves hair, scalp, and skin health," she concluded. These simple changes help maintain healthy locks while avoiding uncomfortable infections and damage.

woman drying her with blowdryer

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Archaeologist Solves Ancient Roman 'Jigsaw Puzzle' Hidden for 1,800 Years
fields.summary: After months of painstaking reconstruction, archaeologists have unveiled vibrant Roman frescoes hidden for nearly 1,800 years in London, piecing together thousands of fragments that offer new insights into the city's ancient past.
fields.content:
Monumental Reconstruction Effort

An extraordinary archaeological discovery in London has revealed vibrant Roman frescoes hidden for almost two millennia. Thousands of shattered plaster fragments were excavated from a large pit where ancient Romans had dumped them after demolishing a luxurious building before A.D. 200. Museum of London Archaeology specialist Han Li spent three months reassembling the pieces, which formed intricate decorations that once covered about 20 interior walls of a high-status structure in Southwark.

Han Li holding box of fragments

Rare Artistic Treasures

The frescoes' reconstruction reveals stunning yellow panels decorated with black intervals featuring birds, fruit, flowers and lyres - a design intended to showcase the property owner's immense wealth and refined taste. Museum officials emphasized the rarity of these yellow panels, which have been found at only a few Roman sites across the country. According to their statement, "While panel designs were common during the Roman period, yellow panels weren't."

Mosaic pieces laid out

Historians discovered a fragment bearing what would have been the artist's signature, but it was broken precisely at the name location, meaning the creator's identity will likely remain unknown forever. Among other discoveries at the site was ancient graffiti including a drawing of a crying woman with a distinct Flavian period hairstyle and Greek alphabet inscriptions.

Split image of art, han li working with fragments

Han Li described the reconstruction as a "once in a lifetime moment" and compared it to solving "the world's most difficult jigsaw puzzle" due to the jumbled fragments from different walls. "I felt a mix of excitement and nervousness when I started to lay the plaster out," she recalled. These frescoes provide a vivid look into Roman Britain between A.D. 43 and 410, revealing new artistic elements from the era of nearly four centuries of Roman rule whose remnants continue to emerge.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Caitlin Clark Sidelined for Fifth Consecutive Game with Groin Injury
fields.summary: Indiana Fever star Caitlin Clark will miss her fifth straight contest due to a groin injury, extending her total absences to 10 games this season despite maintaining strong statistical performance.
fields.content:
Indiana Fever standout Caitlin Clark will be absent for her fifth consecutive game as she continues recovering from a groin injury. The WNBA rookie has already missed four games during this injury stretch, during which the Fever secured three wins.

This upcoming absence marks Clark's ninth missed regular-season game in 2024, plus an additional absence in the Commissioner's Cup final. Earlier this season, she sat out five games due to a left quad strain.

Caitlin Clark on the ground

Remarkably, Clark hasn't missed any games in her professional or collegiate career before this challenging season, highlighting her usual durability and consistent court presence.

Caitlin Clark drives

Despite the absences, Clark's performance remains impressive with season averages of 18.2 points, 8.9 assists, and five rebounds per game. The Fever currently hold a 9-8 win-loss record and have secured victories in four of their last five matchups heading into Saturday's game against the Los Angeles Sparks.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Google's New AI Feature Transforms Photo Search Capabilities
fields.summary: Google Photos introduces its AI-powered Ask Photos feature using Gemini AI to enable natural language searches, making photo retrieval smarter and more intuitive through advanced image analysis.
fields.content:
Revolutionizing Photo Organization

Google Photos evolves beyond basic storage with its Ask Photos feature, leveraging the Gemini AI model to analyze image context including locations, people, and visual quality. This enables complex queries like identifying 'best birthday party photos' by recognizing themes and key moments.

ask photos 2

Enhanced Features and Accessibility

After initial refinement, the enhanced rollout combines classic search results with AI-generated answers on one interface. Simple terms like "cats" deliver instant matches, while complex requests process faster. Users can disable AI search via app settings for traditional filtering.

Privacy and Availability

Currently expanding to U.S. users meeting age and language requirements, the system maintains privacy protections: Photos aren't used for ads, and only select queries get reviewed for improvements. Face recognition requires enabled Face Groups.

ask photos 3

Transforming Memory Recall

This advancement simplifies locating specific moments, from individual images to event sequences, through natural language processing. The integration of Gemini AI positions Ask Photos as a powerful tool for navigating extensive photo libraries.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Owen Wilson Shines in New Sports Comedy Series 'Stick' on Apple TV+
fields.summary: Owen Wilson stars in Apple TV+'s new sports comedy 'Stick,' playing a washed-up golf prodigy turned coach in a lighthearted series blending humor and underdog inspiration.
fields.content:
A refreshing contrast to high-stakes dramas dominating streaming platforms, 'Stick' offers viewers a laidback sports comedy anchored by Owen Wilson's signature charm. The series follows Pryce 'Stick' Cahill—a former golf phenom whose career implosion left him working at a sporting goods store and navigating divorced life.

Wilson's character finds renewed purpose after meeting teenage golf prodigy Santi (Peter Dager), leading to a comeback journey as an unconventional coach. The premise blends elements of classic sports movies with Wilson's trademark wit, creating what critics describe as 'Ted Lasso meets Happy Gilmore.'

Release Schedule and Episode Details

The 10-episode first season premiered June 4, with new episodes releasing weekly. Three final episodes remain after seven initial installments:

Episodes 1-7: Available now
Episode 8: July 9
Episode 9: July 16
Season Finale: July 23

Cast and Creative Connections

Judy Greer plays Pryce's ex-wife, while Marc Maron stars as his former caddy turned partner-in-crime. Notably, Pryce's career collapse mirrors the cinematic breakdown of Luke Wilson's tennis pro character in Wes Anderson's 'The Royal Tenenbaums'—written by Owen Wilson and Anderson.

Early reviews highlight Wilson's ability to balance humor with heartfelt moments, avoiding potential clichés through charismatic delivery. The series joins Apple TV+'s growing comedy lineup, including 'Ted Lasso' and 'Shrinking,' as a potential crowd-pleaser for sports and humor fans alike.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Euro 2025's Toughest Group: England and Wales Face Major Challenge
fields.summary: England and Wales face a formidable challenge in Euro 2025's Group D, labeled the tournament's toughest group alongside France and the Netherlands. With three top-ranked teams, both nations aim to navigate a path to knockout stages.
fields.content:
England and Wales enter Euro 2025 confronting what analysts call the tournament's most challenging group. Group D features world No.5 England, 10th-ranked France, 11th-ranked Netherlands, and 30th-ranked Wales - marking three teams in FIFA's top 11.

World rankings for teams in Euro 2025 Group D

A Statistically Daunting Group

Netherlands manager Andries Jonker labeled Group D the "toughest of all," with Opta's supercomputer giving it a 37% chance of producing tournament winners. Football journalist Tom Garry noted the risk of both British teams being eliminated before their final head-to-head match.

Champions and Contenders

Sarina Wiegman with Euro 2022 trophy

England seeks to defend their 2022 title under coach Sarina Wiegman, who previously led Netherlands to 2017 glory. Both teams boast remarkable group-stage records - England with 14 consecutive wins and Netherlands undefeated in 13 matches.

France's New Era

France enters on an eight-game winning streak despite controversial exclusions of veterans Wendie Renard and Eugénie Le Sommer. Defender Lucy Bronze calls their opening match against England "the most exciting group game," while French player Selma Bacha welcomes the early test.

Welsh Underdog Spirit

Wales players celebrate Euro 2025 qualification

First-time qualifiers Wales embrace their underdog status, bolstered by recent draws against Sweden. Forward Jess Fishlock states they'll use low expectations as motivation, though history shows only one debutant in six Euros has progressed from groups.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: How Criminal Networks Exploit Probate Weaknesses to Steal Millions from the Dead
fields.summary: An investigation reveals organized criminal networks in the UK have systematically forged wills to steal millions from deceased individuals' estates, exploiting vulnerabilities in the digital probate system and committing widespread inheritance tax fraud while leaving rightful heirs helpless.
fields.content:
In late 2023, sisters Lisa and Nicole received unexpected news that they had inherited a substantial sum from their late Aunt Christine. Their relief turned to dismay when a stranger named Tamas Szvercsok emerged, presenting a will that designated him as the sole heir to her entire estate, including her Wimbledon house valued at nearly £1 million.

This man had no known connection to Christine or her family. Despite multiple red flags in his claim—including misspelled addresses and fabricated details—police and probate officials declined to investigate. Research suggests Szvercsok is part of a broader criminal network exploiting UK probate weaknesses.

Extract from Christine Harverson's will naming Tamas Szvercsok as executor and beneficiary

Exploiting Vacant Estates

The fraud exploits the Bona Vacantia register listing estates without wills. Szvercsok produced his contested document after legitimate heir-hunter Anglia Research Services identified Lisa and Nicole as beneficiaries. He claimed to be Christine's "dear friend," though her family had never heard of him.

Matt Boardman, a former police officer with Anglia Research, noted significant discrepancies: Christine's address misspelled, and Szvercsok listed a building unbuilt when the will dated. When confronted, Szvercsok insisted via email he was the sole executor. Authorities instructed the sisters to pursue costly civil court action to challenge the will.

Joe Dixey/BBC Sue at a terraced house

Pattern of Fraud Emerges

Similar cases surfaced with Charles Haxton’s estate. After his death in 2021, a Hungarian man named Roland Silye submitted a will giving him Haxton’s London home plus a nonexistent £2 million Hertfordshire property—with an estate value suspiciously listed as £320,500, just below the £325,000 inheritance tax threshold.

Fraud examiner Graham Barrow identified connections between Silye and Szvercsok—both Hungarian nationals sharing addresses within a complex web of companies. Silye also cleared probate for George Woon’s estate in west London, benefiting from its £360,000 property sale. Barrow noted this pattern signals organized crime dispersing funds across shell companies.

Joe Dixey/BBC Roye Chapman at a red brick house

Forged Signatures and Tax Evasion

Handwriting expert Christina Strang observed identical writing styles across multiple forged wills attributed to Silye and another Hungarian, Bela Kovacs—who claimed Michael Judd’s estate near London despite Judd admitting his will was lost and beneficiaries deceased. HM Revenue & Customs suspended accounts linked to these cases and halted one property sale.

Kovacs listed Judd’s estate at £310,000 while neighboring John Jay’s will raises concerns with properties inexplicably added to it. Authorities face criticism for not verifying unusual entries like these prior to granting probate.

Christina Strang examining documents

Systemic Vulnerabilities

Former MP Sir Bob Neill blamed digitization of probate in 2017 for creating loopholes: "A purely automated system isn't good at picking up fraud." Previously, executors swore oaths in person before registrars who could assess legitimacy. Now automated checks accept declarations about inheritance tax without scrutiny.

Matt Boardman expressed alarm: "Goodness knows how many of these forged wills have slipped through." The Ministry of Justice stated it works with law enforcement against such crimes, but Sir Bob noted probate lacks political prioritization despite victims like Lisa suffering prolonged distress: "It's just a whole nightmare."

Sir Bob Neill in suit jacket

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Namibia Suspends State Funerals Amid Rising Cost Controversy
fields.summary: Namibia's government has implemented a temporary ban on state funerals until 2026 following public scrutiny over soaring costs, with officials revealing expenditures reached $2.2 million this fiscal year for official ceremonies.
fields.content:
Authorities have suspended all state-sponsored funerals until April 2026 pending a comprehensive review of burial protocols and costs. President Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah retains exclusive authority to grant exceptions during this period.

Information Minister Emma Theofelus confirmed the decision after a Cabinet meeting, announcing a seven-member review committee will reassess criteria for official funerals. The move follows growing concerns about expenditures documented in local media reports.

Cost Comparisons Reveal Spending Surge

Financial records show dramatic increases in funeral expenses, with current year costs reaching 38.4 million Namibian dollars ($2.2 million) compared to 2.1 million dollars spent on 23 funerals in 2022/2023. The government hasn't directly linked the moratorium to these figures despite public speculation.

Memorial service for former President Sam Nujoma with national flag-draped coffin

Founding President's Funeral Costs

Approximately 30 million Namibian dollars was allocated for transporting the remains of independence leader Sam Nujoma across Namibia prior to his February 2024 state funeral. The founding president, who died at 95, led the nation's liberation movement and served as its first post-independence leader from 1990 to 2005.

Prime Minister Elijah Ngurare previously highlighted the financial burden of state funerals, with discussions about cost containment emerging as early as 2021 during COVID-19 budget challenges. The review committee is expected to establish new guidelines balancing national honors with fiscal responsibility.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: US and Vietnam Strike Major Trade Deal With Reduced Tariffs
fields.summary: The United States and Vietnam have reached a new trade agreement reducing import tariffs on Vietnamese goods from 46% to 20%, while addressing concerns over trans-shipping practices and enhancing market access for US products.
fields.content:
Tariff Reductions and Market Access

President Donald Trump announced a revised trade agreement with Vietnam that reduces U.S. tariffs on Vietnamese imports to 20%, down from the previously planned 46% levy set to take effect next week. Vietnam committed to eliminating tariffs on American products entirely, granting what Trump called "TOTAL ACCESS" for U.S. goods.

A 40% tariff will apply to goods trans-shipped through Vietnam, targeting products allegedly rerouted from China to bypass U.S. sanctions. Trump's trade advisor Peter Navarro claimed a third of Vietnam’s exports to the U.S. originate from Chinese manufacturers.

Industry Reactions and Economic Impact

Vietnamese manufacturing hubs for brands like Nike and Apple saw temporary stock price increases following the announcement. Adam Sitkoff of the American Chamber of Commerce in Hanoi expressed cautious optimism, stating companies would continue operations despite lingering taxes while questioning the enforcement of trans-shipping rules.

Critics argue tariffs often raise consumer prices, as importers typically pass costs to buyers. The deal adds to recent U.S. trade negotiations with Britain and China, following Trump's broader April tariffs aimed at achieving "reciprocity."

Expanding Trump Investments

Simultaneously, Vietnam approved a $1.5 billion Trump Organization project with local partners to develop hotels, golf courses, and luxury properties. The company is also exploring sites for a Trump Tower in Ho Chi Minh City. Vietnamese leader To Lam reportedly invited Trump for an official visit during their recent call.

The White House described the agreement as part of its strategy to rebalance global trade relationships, with over 60 economies initially facing tariff hikes before negotiations.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: UK Workers Face Two-Year Delay for Key Employment Rights
fields.summary: Implementation of major employment protections including day-one unfair dismissal rights and a ban on exploitative zero-hours contracts has been postponed until 2027 to address business concerns, creating a phased timeline that sparks debate between workers' groups and employers.
fields.content:
The implementation timeline for significant new workers' rights has been extended with day-one protection against unfair dismissal now scheduled for 2027. This delay from the original 2026 target also affects guaranteed flexible working arrangements and prohibitions on exploitative zero-hours contracts. Government officials indicate this revised schedule responds to business concerns and aims to provide clarity for planning.

Business Secretary Jonathan Reynolds emphasized a balanced approach, stating phasing would coordinate meaningful worker protections with operational realities. However, business advocacy groups immediately warned this would trigger disruptive changes that could impede hiring. Tina McKenzie, Policy Chair at the Federation of Small Businesses, noted most small firms lack dedicated HR teams to navigate the incoming regulatory complexity.

Staged Implementation Plan

Several components of the Employment Rights Bill will still take effect from April 2025, including elimination of statutory sick pay eligibility rules that currently require workers to wait until the fourth day of illness and earn at least £125 weekly. Additional early measures encompass enhanced whistleblower protections plus the introduction of immediate paternity leave and unpaid parental leave rights.

From October 2025, bans on controversial fire-and-rehire tactics will take effect alongside reforms ensuring fairer distribution of tips. The complete package featuring day-one dismissal protection and zero-hours contract prohibitions remains coordinated for 2027 implementation. Notably, workers will undergo nine-month probation periods allowing employers simpler dismissal pathways during this phase.

Business Impacts and Reactions

Projected implementation costs for businesses reach approximately £5 billion according to government estimates, compounding recent increases in National Insurance and minimum wage obligations. British Chambers of Commerce Policy Director Alex Veitch cautioned this creates high risk for unintended economic impacts including constrained hiring and growth limitations.

Trade unions expressed frustration with the delay despite welcoming the eventual reforms. TUC General Secretary Paul Nowak characterized these rights as long overdue, demanding urgency in establishing protections. Meanwhile, political opposition criticized the timeline shift with Shadow Business Secretary Andrew Griffith characterizing it as another government U-turn. The legislation additionally simplifies trade union recognition processes and repeals constraints on strikes for essential service workers.

Now progressing through the House of Lords, the bill establishing these rights across England, Scotland and Wales anticipates autumn passage. A new Fair Work Agency will enforce these provisions upon full implementation.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Stop telling me to lower my cortisol - it's making me stressed!
fields.summary: As warnings about cortisol overload flood social media with quick fixes and alarming health claims, experts reveal why these simple solutions often backfire and how genuinely addressing underlying stressors is key to managing this vital hormone effectively.
fields.content:
Cortisol warnings seem to have taken over social media, claiming this stress hormone could alter facial shapes, increase waistlines, and trigger hair loss. My feeds overflow with solutions: cortisol cocktails blending orange juice with coconut water and sea salt, supplements, and lavender balm applications.

Without knowing my actual cortisol levels, assessing the need for reduction proves challenging. Yet I notice my cheeks appearing puffier and my jeans feeling snugger lately. Cortisol, produced by adrenal glands, regulates our body's stress response while managing essential functions from waking to sleeping.

Getty Images A cortisol cocktail in a large plastic glass - a blend of orange, coconut water and sea salt

While cortisol is essential for survival, excess amounts cause various health issues. Scrolling through social media for solutions only increases anxiety, with the first advice ironically suggesting: turn off your phone. Professor John Wass, an endocrinology expert at Oxford University, notes: "We likely live with higher cortisol levels partly because we never switch off, especially with smartphones disrupting our peace".

Wass questions direct links between cortisol and body changes: "Weight gain or facial swelling could stem from poor sleep, medication, salt intake, or alcohol rather than cortisol alone. Stress manifests through complex interactions".

A story of burnout and awakening

Emma Lynch/BBC Jasleen is wearing all white sat on a sofa with a cup of tea next to her

Jasleen Kaur Carroll experienced this complexity firsthand. As a tech company director, constant pressure led to burnout that manifested as severe physical and emotional exhaustion, triggering dormant lupus symptoms: joint pain, breathing difficulties, and weight loss. "I lived like everything was failing", the 33-year-old Londoner says.

She desperately tried social media solutions including cortisol cocktails, ashwagandha, turmeric, and lavender balm with no improvement. Her journey shifted when hospitalization forced reevaluation: "I needed to address trauma causes through therapy and mindfulness rather than symptom suppression".

JASLEEN KAUR CARROLL Jasleen in a hospital bed with a tube inserted into her neck.

Mindfulness, myths and medical realities

Therapist Neil Shah at the Stress Management Society explains: Stress hormones become problematic when we perceive constant threats in our 24/7 lifestyle. When Shah advised standing barefoot on grass, skeptical Jasleen tried it during recovery. Scientific studies support mindfulness for regulating cortisol by rewiring brain structures—as a skeptic learned, holding and mindfully experiencing a raisin created profound present-moment focus.

Professor David Creswell identifies multiple proven approaches for cortisol reduction: mindfulness, exercise, journaling, fostering relationships, and therapy: "These techniques train us to sit with minor discomforts, building resilience against major stressors". Experts like wellbeing specialist Sir Cary Cooper warn against social media's simplistic solutions: "A cortisol cocktail won't harm you, but it won't reduce cortisol either".

High cortisol levels could indicate Cushing's Syndrome—a rare condition from prolonged steroid use or glandular abnormalities requiring medical attention. Cooper emphasizes: "Treating symptoms misses root causes like relationship strains or financial troubles. Social media hacks can't solve these".

Emma Lynch/BBC Composite image of Jasleen carrying out stress reducing exercises

Jasleen now balances a marketing job and motherhood despite previous warnings she couldn't conceive. Each morning she practices grounding exercises—body tapping, energy visualization, and dry brushing—to stimulate her nervous system: "I have tools to embrace life's chaos consciously. Remaining social media-cautious keeps my world calmer".

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Prince William Warns Ocean Life Faces Unprecedented Threats
fields.summary: Prince William delivered a stark address at the Blue Economy Forum in Monaco, declaring ocean protection challenges unlike any previously faced as marine ecosystems visibly deteriorate. The speech highlighted oceans' vital role in global oxygen production, climate regulation, and food security while calling for urgent international conservation efforts.
fields.content:
The Prince of Wales asserted that safeguarding the world's oceans presents a challenge "like none that we have ever faced before." Addressing the Blue Economy and Finance Forum in Monaco, he observed that marine biodiversity is "diminishing before our eyes," insisting this crisis requires ambitious action at global, national, and local levels.

Speaking both English and French at the Grimaldi Forum, Prince William emphasized oceans' fundamental importance: "Healthy oceans are essential to all life on earth. They generate half of the world's oxygen, regulate our climate and provide food for more than three billion people." He cited rising temperatures, pollution, and overfishing as primary drivers of marine degradation.

The forum precedes the UN Ocean Conference in Nice this week, with both gatherings examining ocean roles in trade, food security, and renewable energy. Audience members included environmentalists, scientists, and investors exploring ocean protection financing. The Prince acknowledged barriers to investment, noting protection efforts often seem "distant and disconnected from our everyday lives," despite their critical importance.

As founder of the Earthshot Prize—awarding £1 million annually to climate solutions—Prince William stated: "We must realise the potential of the blue economy for our ecosystems, our economies and our communities." Among attendees were Earthshot finalists like Enric Sala of the Pristine Seas project, who contributed to Sir David Attenborough's documentary "Oceans." Prince William called this film "the most compelling argument for immediate action I have ever seen."

"Watching human activity reduce beautiful sea forests to barren deserts at the base of our oceans is heartbreaking," he declared. "It can no longer be a matter of 'out of sight, out of mind.'" Quoting Attenborough, he concluded: "If we save the sea, we save our world."

Kensington Palace termed the address a "landmark intervention." During his Monaco visit, Prince William met with Costa Rica's President Rodrigo Chaves, France's Emmanuel Macron, and conservation advocate Prince Albert II before participating in closed-door discussions with ocean experts and financiers.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Tesla Robotaxis Under Investigation Following Erratic Behavior Reports
fields.summary: US regulators are investigating Tesla's autonomous vehicle program after social media footage reportedly showed its robotaxis violating traffic laws during their first public road tests in Texas, raising safety concerns about the emerging technology.
fields.content:
Regulatory Scrutiny Intensifies

The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration confirmed it contacted Tesla regarding multiple incidents involving the company's driverless vehicles. This follows viral videos showing robotaxis stopping abruptly near emergency vehicles, swerving between lanes, and exhibiting unpredictable behavior during Sunday's debut in Austin.

Test Run Challenges

Tesla conducted limited trials with 12 vehicles carrying vetted passengers under strict weather and route conditions. Elon Musk praised the launch as a "decade of hard work," but observers documented numerous operational issues. TechCrunch reported one vehicle suddenly halted when passing a parked police cruiser, while others allegedly exceeded speed limits.

Competitive Pressures Mount

The rollout trails rivals like Waymo and Zoox, which already operate driverless fleets in multiple US cities. Tesla's camera-only autonomous system differs from competitors' sensor-heavy approaches, prompting debates about safety and scalability. NHTSA emphasized manufacturers bear responsibility for certifying vehicle safety under current regulations.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Denied Bail Amid Mixed Verdict in Federal Case
fields.summary: Hip-hop mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs remains jailed after being convicted of transporting individuals for prostitution but acquitted of racketeering and sex-trafficking charges. A New York judge cited his history of violence while denying bail ahead of sentencing, where he faces up to 20 years.
fields.content:
A federal judge denied bail to Sean 'Diddy' Combs following his conviction for transportation to engage in prostitution, though he was cleared of more severe racketeering and sex-trafficking charges. Defense attorneys argued his private jet being stationed in Hawaii proved no flight risk, but Judge Arun Subramanian pointed to Combs' violent history as grounds for detention.

Jurors deliberated for 13 hours over two days before acquitting the music executive on three major charges. Prosecutors had accused Combs of operating a criminal network exploiting women through his entertainment empire.

Reuters Three people walk through a crowd of cameras

Key testimony came from musician Casandra Ventura, who described being coerced into sexual acts and threatened with leaked videos. Surveillance footage showed Combs assaulting Ventura in a 2016 hotel incident, which prosecutors said he attempted to conceal through bribes.

Defense lawyer Marc Agnifilo acknowledged his client’s history of domestic violence but attributed it to substance abuse rather than criminal enterprise. Combs faces additional civil lawsuits alleging sexual misconduct as sentencing approaches on October 3.

The Bad Boy Records founder, whose career expanded into fashion and media, could receive a maximum 20-year prison term. Emotional scenes unfolded in court as the verdict spared Combs potential life sentences tied to racketeering charges.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: UN Faces Backlash Over Funding Anti-Israel Commission Amid Financial Strain
fields.summary: The United Nations faces criticism for allocating up to $704,000 for new positions in a controversial commission accused of anti-Israel bias, despite ongoing budget shortages and calls to prioritize essential services.
fields.content:
Critics have condemned the United Nations for expanding funding to its Independent International Commission of Inquiry (COI) on Palestinian territories while the organization grapples with financial constraints. The COI announced four senior-level positions in June 2024, with projected salaries ranging between $530,000 and $704,000 annually.

Navi Pillay

Allegations of Bias and Historical Parallels

Human rights expert Anne Bayefsky accused the COI of aiming to undermine Israel, citing its June report comparing Israeli actions to Nazi extermination policies. The report allegedly dismissed evidence of Hamas using hospitals for military purposes and accused Israeli forces of institutionalized sexual violence.

Pro-Palestinian-demonstrators

U.S. Response and Funding Disputes

The U.S. government has repeatedly criticized the COI’s scope and alleged bias, with congressional representatives previously urging defunding. A State Department official stated President Trump prioritizes fiscal responsibility in international contributions, though no final funding decisions have been announced.

The United Nations building in New York City.

UN Human Rights Council spokesperson Pascal Sim declined to address specific funding questions, noting member states are continuing consultations. Meanwhile, internal documents reveal over a dozen reports and initiatives postponed due to budget shortages.

Calls for Accountability

Bayefsky urged the U.S. to withhold UN funding entirely until reforms occur, arguing American taxpayers provide 27% of the organization’s budget. She emphasized the need to deny visas to COI members visiting the U.S., stating: ‘We need a new boat, not new deck chairs.’

State Department building

UN officials acknowledged systemic challenges in managing resources, with spokesperson Stephane Ryder referencing failed reform attempts over two decades. The Human Rights Council’s June letter detailed canceled regional workshops and incomplete studies due to underfunding.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Xi Jinping's Absence at BRICS Summit Sparks Global Speculation
fields.summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping's unprecedented no-show at the BRICS Summit has ignited debates about Beijing's leadership in the expanding bloc, as trade conflicts and India's rising influence reshape alliances.
fields.content:
A Leadership Void and Geopolitical Tensions

Xi Jinping's first-ever absence from the BRICS gathering surprised observers, with Chinese authorities citing scheduling conflicts. Premier Li Qiang's attendance continues Xi's recent pattern of reduced global engagement. Analysts like Bryan Burack from the Heritage Foundation suggest the move reveals growing fractures: 'BRICS won't become China's vassal state. Members like Brazil and Indonesia recently imposed tariffs against Chinese trade practices.'

Chinese President Xi Jinping, right, and Russian President Vladimir Putin

Expanding Influence Amid Fragmentation

The bloc now includes 12 members like Egypt and Iran, representing 60% of global GDP and 75% of the world's population. Economist Christian Briggs notes their control over critical minerals and trade routes. However, Burack highlights inherent divisions: 'These countries fundamentally oppose each other. China's dumping practices hurt partners, limiting real unity.'

World leaders pose at BRICS Summit last year.

The Currency Debate and India's Role

While BRICS aims to challenge dollar dominance, experts remain skeptical. Burack calls currency fears 'overblown,' noting conflicting member interests. Conversely, Briggs points to growing use of alternative payment systems handling trillions. India emerges as a key stabilizer, with analyst Chang stating: 'Modi prevents BRICS from becoming anti-Western. As long as India stays, the bloc won't threaten global balance.'

President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India, held a joint press conference in the Rose Garden of the White House.

Xi's absence draws conflicting interpretations—some see weakening influence, others view it as confidence in China's entrenched dominance. As BRICS navigates internal contradictions and external ambitions, the summit highlights both the bloc's potential and its limitations in reshaping global order.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: NASA Finalizes Plan to Sustain Permanent Human Presence in Space
fields.summary: NASA has unveiled its finalized strategy for maintaining continuous American-led human presence in space, emphasizing the transition from the International Space Station to commercial platforms by 2030 while addressing budget challenges and international leadership concerns.
fields.content:
Strategy for Sustained Space Operations

NASA's Low Earth Orbit Microgravity Strategy establishes a framework for permanent human presence in orbit, supporting economic expansion and preserving global partnerships. Deputy Administrator Pam Melroy explained the agency's approach: "Just like everybody has to make hard decisions when the budget is tight, we made choices to cut or cancel programs to focus on our highest priorities." Jeffrey Manber of Voyager Space highlighted industry concerns: "We need that commitment because our investors are asking if the United States remains dedicated to space leadership."

Seen here is Jeffrey Manber, President of International and Space Stations at Voyager Space.

Defining Permanent Presence

NASA clarified that "continuous human presence" means maintaining active occupation of a space station without interruption. The strategy emerged amid discussions about the International Space Station's scheduled decommissioning by 2030 after hosting astronauts from 23 countries continuously since 1998. Melroy addressed concerns at an October conference: "The only other space station in orbit without replacements would be China's. We aim to remain the partner of choice globally and retain U.S. leadership in spaceflight." This policy continues initiatives started during the Trump administration and maintained under Biden.

A rendering shows a space station that could replace the International Space Station, which is intended to be deorbited in 2030.

Transition Timeline Amid Budget Constraints

Budget limitations from Congressional agreements create challenges, but NASA maintains its 2030 target for operational commercial stations. Melroy outlined the approach: "We co-invest with partners to develop platforms. Despite funding reductions, we'll achieve continuous American presence in orbit before 2030." Voyager Space maintains its schedule to launch a station in 2028. Competition remains essential according to Melroy: "Different partners bring varied strengths. We must preserve multiple options to determine successful models." The plan acknowledges historical commitments, quoting Ronald Reagan's 1984 vision: "America has always been greatest when we dared to be great."

A space station that could replace the International Space Station, which is intended to be deorbited in 2030.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: How High Temperatures Impact Brain Function and Mental Health
fields.summary: Medical experts reveal how prolonged heat exposure affects cognitive performance, exacerbates mental health conditions, and alters medication responses while offering protective strategies.
fields.content:
Neurological and Psychological Impacts

Dr. Jace Reed, an emergency psychiatry director, warns that heat significantly impacts brain function, potentially affecting social interactions and professional performance. Extreme confusion could signal heat stroke requiring immediate medical attention.

woman sits outside in summer heat

Psychologist Thea Gallagher explains that overheating disrupts the body's internal balance, increasing oxidative stress and inflammation that damages neurons. This may worsen neurological disorders and compromise the blood-brain barrier's protective functions.

depressed woman

Antidepressants like SSRIs create dual risks: some medications reduce sweating (hindering cooling) while others cause excessive perspiration leading to dehydration. Patients with cognitive impairments may struggle to recognize overheating symptoms.

woman argues with man outside

Prevention Strategies

Gallagher advises prioritizing rest and hydration during heatwaves. Maintaining sleep routines and reducing activity levels can help protect brain health when temperatures rise.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: TikTok Host Sparks Debate After Guests Critique Rental For Not Being 'Weight Accessible'
fields.summary: A TikTok user's viral video details guests leaving a two-star review claiming his rental property lacked accommodations for their size, citing issues with doorways and furniture weight limits while prompting discussions about accommodation standards.
fields.content:
A TikTok host gained widespread attention after sharing a video about guests who gave his rental property a two-star review for not being "weight accessible." The post received over 20,000 likes and hundreds of responses.

"I guess they were on the larger side and my house didn’t perfectly accommodate their size," the host explained. The guests reportedly claimed they couldn't fit through standard doorframes, to which the host responded, "I have standard door frames."

The visitors also complained about furniture stability, stating "some of the furniture seemed shaky at best, and we felt scared we were going to break it." They additionally noted an egg chair with a manufacturer's 330-pound weight limit prevented them from using it.

person looking at apps on phone

The host responded to the complaints by telling the guests: "I might say this house isn’t a good fit for you," maintaining the situation taught him nothing but might educate the renters.

Airbnb lists accessibility features including doorways wider than 32 inches. The platform has grown since 2007 to include over 5 million hosts worldwide who have welcomed 2 billion guests.

Should overweight customers be footing the bill for their excess baggage?

Viewers debated the situation in TikTok comments, with one questioning: "If they couldn't fit through the door frame, how'd they know about the rest of the things?" Others defended the host: "Thank you for handling this with professionalism. Unfortunately, entitlement comes in all sizes."

Some commenters shared personal perspectives: "I'm plus size. This level of entitlement is crazy. I always check weight limits," while another advised: "I read the low reviews for this reason. Sometimes the issues do not apply to me."

keys to a home

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Controversy Erupts Over Analyst's Claim That Fever Are Better Without Caitlin Clark
fields.summary: An ESPN analyst sparked controversy by claiming the Indiana Fever perform better without injured rookie Caitlin Clark, triggering widespread criticism amid statistics showing the team's offensive efficiency significantly declines in her absence.
fields.content:
The Controversial Comments

ESPN analyst Carolyn Peck sparked outrage by suggesting the Indiana Fever pose a greater threat without star rookie Caitlin Clark. "I think that Indiana is even more dangerous when Caitlin Clark doesn’t play, because she’s a ball-dominant guard," Peck stated. "The ball’s in her hands a lot, so you know what you need to try to take away."

Peck contended that without Clark, the Fever better utilize other weapons like Kelsey Mitchell making perimeter plays and Aliyah Boston dominating inside. "Indiana, they are a threat. And it’s specifically on the defensive end," she asserted. This perspective emerged as Clark continues to miss games due to a groin injury, absent for the Fever's last four contests.

Caitlin Clark dribbles

Fierce Backlash

Peck's comments quickly ignited social media backlash. Barstool Sports founder Dave Portnoy reposted the analysis clip on X, commenting simply: "I knew this was gonna happen." Popular sports account BricksCenter suggested the critique reflected broader animosity, writing, "Their hatred toward CC needs to be studied."

Numerous fans joined in criticizing Peck. One asserted, "ESPN would be a lot more 'dangerous' without Carolyn Peck," while another dismissed her perspective: "All of Peck's takes on CC last year ended being wrong and I don't expect anything different." Some reactions escalated to personal attacks, labeling Peck "a hater and a fool." The scrutiny highlighted Peck's history with the Fever organization—she coached current Indiana coach Stephanie White when Purdue won the 1999 NCAA championship.

Aliyah Boston and his teammates

Performance Statistics

Statistics contradict Peck's assessment about Clark's impact. When Clark plays, the Fever hold a 5–4 record while averaging 85.0 in offensive rating. Without her, though they maintain an identical 5–4 win-loss record, their offensive rating drops significantly to 80.2. In appearances, Clark contributes substantially, averaging 18.2 points and 8.9 assists, though she also averages 5.9 turnovers per game. Her ongoing absence marks the second significant injury setback this season—she previously missed five games due to a quad injury.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: 120,000 Fraudulent Websites Target Shoppers During Amazon Prime Day
fields.summary: Security researchers identified over 120,000 fraudulent websites targeting Amazon Prime Day shoppers, offering fake deals and phishing schemes. Discover essential tips to protect yourself during the July 8-11 sales event.
fields.content:
Security researchers have uncovered more than 120,000 fake Amazon websites designed to scam shoppers ahead of the retailer's Prime Day event running July 8-11. These domains emerged rapidly in recent months, combining phishing schemes, counterfeit products, and malware distribution tactics.

The Scale of Digital Deception

laptop shopping

Amazon maintains its fraud detection systems remain active, though the company hasn't specifically addressed the 120,000-site estimate. Official guidelines reiterate that Amazon never requests payment information via email or phone calls.

Exploiting Consumer Trust

online shopping

Cybercriminals employ sophisticated methods including typosquatting domains like 'arnazon.com' and fake customer service calls. Security analysts warn that outdated software and public Wi-Fi use heightens vulnerability to these attacks.

Essential Security Measures

Consumers should implement these protective strategies:

1. Use only Amazon's official website/app for purchases and avoid links from unsolicited messages

2. Install antivirus software to detect phishing attempts and malware

3. Never share passwords or payment details via phone calls

4. Reject requests for gift card payments

5. Scrutinize URLs for subtle misspellings

6. Keep devices and apps updated

7. Avoid transactions on public Wi-Fi networks

8. Monitor financial accounts post-purchase

9. Verify seller ratings before buying suspiciously cheap items

10. Report fraudulent activity to Amazon immediately

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Dominique Thorne Stars in Marvel's 'Ironheart' Series on Disney+
fields.summary: Marvel's new Disney+ series 'Ironheart' follows genius MIT student Riri Williams as she builds advanced armor technology, with Dominique Thorne leading all six episodes now streaming.
fields.content:
Marvel introduces Riri Williams, portrayed by Dominique Thorne, in her own Disney+ series after her debut in 2022's Black Panther: Wakanda Forever. The six-episode show explores her journey as a brilliant inventor creating Stark-tech-inspired armor enhanced with Vibranium.

Release schedule and episode details

All episodes of Ironheart became available through a three-episodes-per-week release pattern, concluding on July 1. The series followed Disney+'s evening drop format at 9:00 PM EST on Tuesdays.

Creative team and cast

Black Panther director Ryan Coogler serves as executive producer, reinforcing his collaboration with Marvel following the character's introduction in Wakanda Forever. Anthony Ramos joins the cast as antagonist The Hood, adding new dynamics to Riri's story.

Complete episode lineup

Episode 1: 'Take Me Home'
Episode 2: 'Will the Real Natalie Please Stand Up?'
Episode 3: 'We in Danger, Girl'
Episode 4: 'Bad Magic'
Episode 5: 'Karma's a Glitch'
Episode 6: 'The Past Is the Past'

Source: Original Article

fields.title: US Aid Workers Injured in Gaza Attack During Relief Operation
fields.summary: Two American humanitarian workers were injured in a grenade attack during aid distribution in southern Gaza, with organizers blaming Hamas militants. The incident occurs amid ongoing ceasefire negotiations and rising Palestinian casualties in Israel's military campaign.
fields.content:
Aid Operation Under Fire

Aid workers from the controversial Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF) were targeted during a relief operation in Khan Younis when two militants threw grenades at their distribution center. The US-backed organization reported both injured American personnel are in stable condition, with no other casualties among staff or civilians.

Reuters Palestinians carry aid supplies from the U.S.-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, in Khan Younis.

Controversial Distribution System

Since launching in May, GHF's Israel-approved aid framework has drawn criticism for requiring Palestinian civilians to navigate active conflict zones. UN data indicates over 400 Palestinians have been killed while attempting to collect supplies through this system. Israeli authorities maintain the protocol prevents aid diversion to Hamas.

Ceasefire Negotiations and Casualty Updates

Hamas has signaled willingness to discuss a US-proposed ceasefire agreement involving hostage-prisoner exchanges but demands modifications. The group seeks dissolution of GHF operations in favor of UN-led distribution. Meanwhile, Gaza health authorities report 32 Palestinians killed in Saturday's military actions, with total war fatalities exceeding 57,000 since Israel's response to Hamas' October 2023 attacks that killed 1,200 Israelis.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Heathrow Threatens Legal Action Against National Grid Over Substation Fire Failures
fields.summary: Heathrow Airport is exploring legal action against National Grid after an investigation revealed a preventable substation fire caused a major shutdown, disrupting thousands of passengers and costing airlines up to £100m.
fields.content:
Heathrow Airport is weighing legal measures against National Grid following findings that a March 20 substation fire resulted from unresolved equipment issues first identified in 2018. A report confirmed moisture infiltration in critical components at the North Hyde substation was repeatedly overlooked, despite warnings.

A bird's eye view of how far the substation is away from Heathrow airport. It is to the north west of the airport

The National Energy System Operator (Neso) stated National Grid deferred maintenance on the faulty bushing insulation multiple times, allowing moisture levels to escalate. Heathrow criticized the energy firm for avoidable lapses, claiming the shutdown affected 270,000 travelers and key local infrastructure, including hospitals and transport networks.

Missed opportunities

Neso CEO Fintan Slye noted National Grid failed to recognize the substation's critical role in powering Heathrow, despite the airport's awareness. The operator missed multiple chances to replace defective parts between 2018 and 2022. Airlines reported losses of £80m-£100m due to flight cancellations.

Ofgem has launched a separate investigation, stressing energy firms must prioritize infrastructure maintenance. National Grid defended its inspection protocols but pledged cooperation. Analysts warn the incident highlights broader vulnerabilities in UK critical infrastructure preparedness.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Council Flies Pride Flag Without Required Permission
fields.summary: Warwickshire County Council faced controversy after flying the Progress Pride flag without required advertising consent, sparking a political dispute with Reform UK officials over regulatory compliance.
fields.content:
A Progress Pride flag dispute erupted when Warwickshire County Council flew the banner without obtaining necessary permissions. Chief Executive Monica Fogarty declined requests from Reform UK's acting leader George Finch to remove it before Pride Month concluded.

Three flags on white poles outside a building

Warwick District Council confirmed the Progress flag required advertising consent under planning regulations, though no formal complaint was filed. The design differs from traditional Pride flags with added stripes representing marginalized LGBTQ+ communities.

Reform UK officials accused Fogarty of overstepping authority, with party leader Nigel Farage suggesting she 'should look for a new job.' The council lacks formal flag policies, prompting calls for clarified procedures.

The flag was removed after Pride Month ended. Reform UK holds the largest council seats but lacks majority control. Planning authorities confirmed no enforcement action was pursued regarding the unauthorized display.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Family Blames Anti-Medicine Beliefs for Daughter's Cancer Death
fields.summary: A young woman's refusal of cancer treatment amid her mother's promotion of alternative therapies sparks warnings about medical misinformation. Her brothers share their story to prevent similar tragedies.
fields.content:
Gabriel and Sebastian Shemirani watched their mother Kate gain notoriety during the pandemic for spreading COVID-19 misinformation, ultimately leading to her removal from the nursing register. Months later, their 23-year-old sister Paloma died from non-Hodgkin lymphoma after declining chemotherapy despite doctors' 80% survival prognosis.

Gabriel and Sebastian Shemirani

Medical professionals express concern that conspiracy theories promoted by figures like US Health Secretary candidate Robert F Kennedy Jr are normalizing dangerous health misinformation. Oncologists warn such trends could lead to preventable deaths.

Conspiracy theories on the school run

The brothers describe growing up immersed in conspiracy theories ranging from staged school shootings to shape-shifting royals. Their mother allegedly used these beliefs to control them, including disabling home wi-fi during critical academic periods.

Kate Shemirani at protest

After surviving breast cancer through alternative therapies in 2012, Kate Shemirani began promoting unproven cancer treatments. Friends recall Paloma avoiding sunscreen and vaccines while balancing skepticism with periods of distancing from her mother's ideology.

A concern regarding parental influence

When diagnosed in December 2023, Paloma initially showed hesitation about chemotherapy. Hospital staff documented concerns about parental pressure after receiving messages from Kate instructing against medical treatment. Paloma ultimately chose Gerson therapy - a regimen involving coffee enemas and strict diets - over chemotherapy.

Text messages between Paloma and partner

Paloma smiling

Promoting misinformation

Kate Shemirani monetizes her alternative health advice through a £195 cancer consultation service while disparaging conventional treatments online. Despite social media bans for COVID-19 misinformation, platforms like X and Facebook have recently reinstated her accounts.

Social media posts

Life support switched off

Paloma's condition deteriorated rapidly under alternative care, with friends noting new tumors and loss of bodily functions. After months of isolation from loved ones, she suffered a fatal heart attack in July 2024. An inquest will examine the circumstances while her mother continues alleging medical malpractice without evidence.

Paloma at Cambridge

Source: Original Article

fields.title: England Mandates Solar Panels on Majority of New Homes
fields.summary: The UK government has announced plans requiring solar panels on nearly all new build homes in England as part of climate targets, estimating £500 annual energy savings per household. Exemptions will apply for properties with unavoidable obstructions, with detailed regulations set for release this autumn.
fields.content:
Mandatory Solar Installations

Builders in England will soon be required to install solar panels on the vast majority of new residential properties under forthcoming regulations announced by Energy Secretary Ed Miliband. The regulations, part of the Future Homes Standard to be published this autumn, mandate solar panels unless specific exemptions apply, such as properties being heavily shaded. Miliband described the policy as "just common sense," stating it would save households approximately £500 annually on energy bills while accelerating the shift toward renewable energy.

The regulations follow prior proposals from the Conservative government, which had suggested solar coverage for 40% of a home's ground area. However, Miliband clarified that unlike previous plans that waived requirements if the 40% threshold couldn't be met, the new rules will insist on some solar installation even when full coverage is unattainable. He emphasized that solar adoption must be "almost universal" on new builds, with only rare exceptions.

Industry Concerns

The Home Builders Federation supports expanding solar usage but warns against excessive bureaucracy. Neil Jefferson, the organization's head, noted that two in five new homes already feature panels and cautioned that requiring builders to seek individual exemptions could create "burdensome" paperwork and undermine the government's target of constructing 1.5 million homes by 2029. He stated, "The government needs to take care not to prescribe too much on rooftops" to avoid slowing housing delivery.

Solar Energy UK's Chris Hewett estimated 90% of new builds will require panels under the rules and called for local authorities to enforce compliance vigilantly. He acknowledged workforce training gaps, telling media, "We need to train more people... that's something we as an industry are working on." Responding to concerns about costs inflating home prices, Miliband asserted the change wouldn't adversely affect housing affordability.

Climate Objectives

The initiative supports Britain's legally binding goal of achieving net zero carbon emissions by 2050. Residential buildings accounted for 20% of UK greenhouse gases in 2022, and the Climate Change Committee has warned that decarbonizing housing is essential for meeting targets. Solar power generation reached record UK levels between January and May this year—42% higher than the same period last year and 160% greater than a decade prior—though it remains the nation's sixth-largest electricity source.

Political parties remain divided on net zero timelines. While Labour retains the 2050 target and recently simplified heat pump installation rules, Conservatives argue it risks lowering living standards. The Liberal Democrats welcomed the solar mandate, with MP Max Wilkinson calling it a win for bill savings and emissions cuts.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: UK Proposes Major Changes to Google Search Dominance
fields.summary: UK regulators propose measures to increase competition in search services, potentially requiring Google to offer users alternative providers and enhance transparency.
fields.content:
The UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) is investigating Google under new legislation that could mandate changes to the search giant's operations. With over 90% market share in UK searches, regulators aim to address concerns about concentrated market power and affordability for businesses spending £33,000 annually on average for Google ads.

Proposed Reforms

Potential measures include introducing "choice screens" allowing users to select preferred search providers and increasing transparency for publishers. CMA CEO Sarah Cardell emphasized these "targeted" changes could improve market openness while maintaining Google's benefits. Alphabet responded that the proposals are overly broad and warned of unintended consequences for innovation.

Industry Impacts

Businesses like EasyJet reported complications from similar EU-mandated changes, citing misrepresented services through third-party platforms. Adult retailers raised concerns about Google's SafeSearch feature limiting content visibility. The News Media Association highlighted ongoing issues with AI tools like Google's AI Overviews using publisher content without proper compensation.

Regulatory scrutiny extends globally, with Google facing a €2.4 billion EU fine for favoring its shopping service and a US court ruling declaring its search monopoly illegal. The CMA will finalize decisions by October after assessing feedback from 47 organizations.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Charges and Verdict: The Sean Combs Legal Saga Unfolded
fields.summary: Sean 'Diddy' Combs was acquitted of racketeering and sex trafficking but convicted on two prostitution counts after a seven-week trial chronicling years of allegations. This timeline details the cascade of civil lawsuits, criminal charges, and key courtroom moments involving the rap mogul.
fields.content:
Rapper and producer Sean 'Diddy' Combs faced verdicts in his New York trial after multiple women accused him of abuse and coercion. While cleared of racketeering and sex trafficking charges, a jury found him guilty on two counts of transportation for prostitution. These criminal proceedings followed numerous civil lawsuits that began surfacing in late 2023, many still ongoing.

16 November 2023: Cassie initiates legal battle

Model and singer Cassie Ventura sued Combs, alleging he established a coercive relationship marked by beatings. She documented 'freak offs' – multi-day, drug-fueled sexual performances involving sex workers that Combs allegedly recorded. Ventura further accused him of sexual abuse and rape.

Getty Images Cassie and Sean Combs

Combs denied all allegations, calling them extortion. Both parties settled privately one day after filing.

November-December 2023: Flood of misconduct claims

Multiple women followed with sexual assault lawsuits accusing Combs of misconduct dating to 1991, including allegations involving a minor. One lawsuit specifically referenced sex trafficking and gang rape. Responding to accumulating cases, Combs declared on Instagram: "ENOUGH IS ENOUGH," dismissing accusations as financial opportunism.

Getty Images Sean Combs

February 2024: Producer alleges grooming

Music producer Rodney Jones Jr sued Combs, claiming pressured participation in sex acts and unwanted advances. Jones stated Combs attempted to 'groom' him by normalizing such behavior in the industry. Combs' lawyer rejected these claims as fabricated, labeling Jones a liar.

May 2024: Hotel assault footage surfaces

CCTV footage leaked showing Combs attacking Cassie Ventura in a Los Angeles hotel hallway, kicking her while down and throwing objects. The mogul publicly confessed responsibility: "I take full responsibility for my actions in that video. I'm disgusted now." Ventura described the assault's lasting damage to her mental health.

September 2024: Arrest and detailed charges

Authorities arrested Combs in Manhattan following a grand jury indictment. Prosecutors then concretized charges: sex trafficking, racketeering and transportation for prostitution involving forced labor, kidnapping, and bribery. Their investigation outlined coordinated 'freak off' events featuring drugging, elite prostitutes, medical teams on standby, and secret filming for blackmail.

Getty Images Sean Combs court sketch

Combs denied all charges while defense attorney Marc Agnifilo argued: "Not if everybody wants to be there."

October 2023-February 2025: Mounting accusations

Lawyers representing over 100 plaintiffs came forward with sexual assault allegations – half being male victims and 25 minors. One accuser was reportedly nine years old during the incident. Notable lawsuits included claims of balcony death threats and links to Tupac Shakur's murder theories as retaliation.

March-April 2025: Expanded indictments

Federal prosecutors added forced labor accusations and two new prostitution charges involving interstate transportation of an unidentified woman. Despite rejecting plea deals, Combs maintained not-guilty pleas to all counts.

May 2025: Trial testimony begins

Prosecutors framed Combs as employing fame and violence to control women. His attorneys countered by acknowledging a 'swinger' lifestyle but denying criminal intent. Cassie Ventura spent four days on the stand detailing beatings and hundreds of coercive 'freak offs' causing physical harm and suicidal thoughts. Rapper Kid Cudi testified that Combs firebombed his Porsche. Protective pseudonym 'Jane' recounted similar pressures into sexual acts with male escorts.

Reuters/Jane Rosenberg In a courtroom sketch, Sean "Diddy" Combs watches as his former girlfriend Casandra "Cassie" Ventura reacts during testimony to prosecutor Emily Johnson

Getty Images Rapper Kid Cudi in a leather jacket walking outside of a building as people with phones and cameras photograph him in the background.

June-July 2025: Closing arguments and verdict

Prosecutors described a 'criminal enterprise' operation in closing, while defense called the trial a 'fake' attempt to vilify consensual activities. The jury ultimately acquitted Combs of racketeering and sex trafficking but convicted him on two prostitution transportation counts involving Cassie Ventura and 'Jane', carrying potential 10-year sentences each. Sentencing remains pending.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: 'Siberian Jesus' Sentenced to Russian Prison Over Cult Activities
fields.summary: Self-proclaimed messiah Sergei Torop receives 9.5-year prison term for operating a Siberian cult that exploited followers through financial manipulation and psychological abuse over three decades.
fields.content:
Sergei Torop, a former traffic officer turned spiritual leader known as 'Vissarion,' has been convicted alongside two associates for systematically extracting funds through coercive tactics while enforcing radical lifestyle rules. The trio's actions reportedly caused significant physical and mental harm to members of their religious community.

Members of the religious sect led by Vissarion

Torop founded the Church of the Last Testament in Siberia's Krasnoyarsk region following the Soviet Union's collapse in 1991. His 'Abode of Dawn' commune attracted thousands seeking spiritual guidance during Russia's turbulent post-Soviet era.

The charismatic leader ordained strict prohibitions against meat, alcohol, tobacco, and money use while positioning himself as a divine messenger. Security forces conducted a dramatic 2020 helicopter raid to arrest Torop and his aides after two decades of investigation.

Cult followers in Russia

A Krasnoyarsk court sentenced Torop to maximum security imprisonment for leading an extremist organization and inflicting grievous bodily harm. Co-defendants Vladimir Vedernikov and Vadim Redkin received 8 and 7-year terms respectively, while Andrey Petrov was acquitted.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Rare Mastodon Jaw Discovered in New York Backyard Sparks Scientific Excitement
fields.summary: A New York homeowner’s backyard has yielded a remarkably well-preserved mastodon jaw along with additional bone fragments, marking the first such discovery in the state in over a decade, according to museum officials.
fields.content:
An Unusual Backyard Find

A resident of Orange County stumbled upon history when two peculiar teeth caught their eye beneath garden plants. Subsequent digging revealed more teeth and led to the discovery of a complete adult mastodon jaw buried inches below the surface. The homeowner described recognizing the significance immediately: "I knew they were something special and decided to call in the experts".

Mastodon tooth

Scientific Significance and Future Exploration

Researchers from the New York State Museum and SUNY Orange unearthed the jaw alongside toe and rib bone fragments during excavations. Museum records indicate this marks the first complete mastodon jaw found in New York since 2013. Of the 150 mastodon fossils documented statewide, a third originate from Orange County.

Mastodon mammal illustration

Cory Harris, a SUNY Orange department chair, emphasized the find’s importance: "The additional bone fragments provide crucial context for understanding this mastodon’s life. We plan expanded searches for related remains." The discovery offers researchers new opportunities to study Ice Age ecosystems in the Hudson Valley region.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: CDC Moves to Phase Out Mercury-Based Ingredient From Flu Vaccines
fields.summary: The CDC's advisory committee has initiated steps to eliminate thimerosal, a mercury-based preservative, from influenza vaccines after keeping it in multi-dose versions despite its removal from most childhood vaccines since 2001, amid ongoing safety discussions.
fields.content:
The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's vaccine advisory committee has advanced plans to phase out thimerosal, a controversial mercury-containing ingredient, from influenza vaccines. This preservative remains present in multi-dose flu shots despite being largely eliminated from childhood immunizations over two decades ago.

Child and pregnant woman vaccines

Committee documents listed a June 26 presentation and recommendations concerning thimerosal-containing influenza vaccines. This action follows longstanding safety concerns that prompted the American Academy of Pediatrics, Public Health Service agencies, and vaccine manufacturers to jointly agree years earlier that thimerosal should be "reduced or eliminated in vaccines."

Currently, multi-dose influenza vaccines available continue to use thimerosal, though alternative formulations exist without the preservative. The CDC maintains that thimerosal has a safety record in medical products is substantial, stating on its website: "Data from many studies show no evidence of harm caused by the low doses of thimerosal in vaccines."

Flu vaccine

Dr. Jacob Glanville, CEO of biotechnology firm Centivax, noted American children haven't routinely received thimerosal-containing vaccines for more than 20 years, but confirmed its continued use in some international multi-dose vials. He emphasized support for complete removal, telling media outlets: "We support any effort to remove it entirely — there are other preservatives that are not based on mercury." Glanville added that his company's vaccines avoid mercury compounds along with aluminum, formaldehyde, and animal-derived materials.

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Serious Water Pollution Incidents Soar 60% Across England
fields.summary: Water pollution incidents classified as serious rose dramatically by 60% across England last year according to Environment Agency data, reaching record levels that threaten ecosystems and public health. Most severe cases were concentrated among three companies, prompting strong criticism from parliamentary oversight bodies over regulatory failures.
fields.content:
Serious pollution incidents caused by water companies climbed by 60% across England last year according to the latest government statistics. These high-risk events identified by the Environment Agency cause serious or lasting environmental damage resulting in aquatic life destruction and public health threats.

A parliamentary Public Accounts Committee report published concurrently described pollution levels as woeful. Water UK the industry representative group has been contacted for commentary.

These findings come days before Monday's scheduled landmark review of the water sector. Chair Sir John Cunliffe will present government recommendations aiming to improve financial performance and environmental compliance.

Environment Agency records reveal water companies discharged pollutants including untreated sewage through treatment infrastructure into rivers 2,801 times during 2024. This marks the highest yearly count compared with 2,174 incidents registered during 2023. Among these 75 incidents caused extreme damage threatening fisheries drinking water safety and human welfare.

Three companies accounted for most severe pollution: Thames Water caused 33 serious incidents Southern Water contributed 15 and Yorkshire Water was responsible for 13. England utilizes a combined sewage system where wastewater and rainwater share infrastructure. Elevated rainfall levels last year reportedly overwhelmed some facilities.

Despite environmental conditions breaches of legal permits occurred whenever discharges caused severe contamination. Although companies self-reported many incidents Environment Agency regulators discovered violations at approximately a quarter of 4,000 inspected sites last year.

Public Accounts Committee chair Sir Geoffrey Clifton-Brown sharply criticized government and agency authorities for inaction. Regulators lack adequate resources to prosecute unlawful company behavior he asserted and cannot establish meaningful deterrence.

The committee concludes regular pollution reflects systematic regulatory shortcomings estimating at current repair progress centuries would pass before water mains networks become completely updated. Environmental regulators pledged stronger protection efforts while urging collaboration between utilities and customers on water conservation practices.

A hand turning on kitchen faucet with saucepan in sink

Source: Original Article

fields.title: Amber storm warnings issued as severe floods threaten widespread UK disruption
fields.summary: Severe amber thunderstorm warnings have been issued across southeast and eastern England, forecasting torrential rain reaching up to 100mm in a few hours that could trigger flash flooding and widespread travel disruptions. The heavy rains follow prolonged drought conditions, which could prevent water absorption and extend existing hosepipe bans throughout summer.
fields.content:
The Met Office has issued amber thunderstorm warnings across southeast and eastern England effective Saturday from 04:00 to 11:00. Torrential downpours are expected to deliver 20-40mm (approximately one inch) of rain per hour in some areas, with localized totals potentially reaching 70-100mm (up to four inches) within a few hours.
